header.abstract: The Barber Clark papers (1971-2013, undated; 3.15 cubic feet; 17 boxes) comprise materials documenting the career of Lexington psychic, Barber Clark.

descriptive_summary.author: Arranged and described by Ida Lucille Sell Mangum and Kaitlyn Moran
descriptive_summary.title: Barber Clark papers
descriptive_summary.creator: Clark, Barber G.
descriptive_summary.arrangement: The collection is arranged by format.
descriptive_summary.prefercite: 2018ms029: [identification of item] Barber Clark papers, 1971-2013, undated, University of Kentucky Libraries Special Collections Research Center.

bioghist.head: Biographical note
bioghist.p: Barber Gedney Clark, born in Port Chester, New York, 1936-2020, was a Lexington, Kentucky based clairvoyant and businesswoman. Barber graduated with a nursing degree from Case Western Reserve University in 1957. From 1960-1977, Barber owned and operated Barber Gross Associates and brokered high-end real estate in the Rye, New York and Greenwich, Connecticut. In the mid-1960s Barber's psychic abilities were tested by noted parapsychology researcher, J.B. Rhine. In 1977, Barber married Donald Clark and closed her real estate agency to focus on developing her psychic skills. In 1980 Barber and Donald relocated to Lexington, Kentucky. By 1981, Barber's visions about celebrities, politicians, the economy, etc. were reported on in regional newspapers. She regularly was a guest of regional radio shows and appeared on television news programs. During the mid-1980s, Barber Clark's predictions were included in national tabloid newspapers like The National Enquirer and The Sun. During the 2000s, Barber Clark offered her psychic talents and readings via websites. She also gave readings as a medium for Arieal, a woman with familial roots in 17th century Salem, Massachusetts.
Source: 2018ms029: Resume and professional statements, 1982-1989, Barber Clark papers, 1971-2013, undated, University of Kentucky Special Collections Research Center.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: The Barber Clark papers (1971-2013, undated; 3.15 cubic feet; 17 boxes) comprise materials documenting the career of Lexington psychic, Barber Clark. The collection consists of letters from television and radio program fans asking for personal predictions from Barber, newspaper articles featuring Barber Clark's forecasts, marketing and publicity items like pamphlets and head shots, and production notes relating to Clark's television and radio station collaborations. There are also VHS tape recordings of Barber Clark's appearances on television and radio, reels, music records, and various realia from her life.

accessrestrict.head: Conditions Governing Access
accessrestrict.p: Collection is open to researchers by appointment.

userestrict.head: Conditions Governing Use
userestrict.p: The physical rights to the materials in this collection are held by the University of Kentucky Libraries Special Collections Research Center.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: The Papers series comprises correspondence, drafts, printed materials, newspaper and magazine clippings, notes and printed materials documenting Barber Clark's career as a psychic from the 1980s through the 2000s. A large portion of the series includes letters from fans of radio and television shows with requests for personal readings or predictions for their future. The series contains professional records like Barber Clark's resume, correspondence with television and radio shows, pamphlets, text content for websites, ephemera from speaking engagements, and professional head shot photographs. Also included are some articles about other professional psychics and studies of the parapsychology field.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: The Photographs series comprises photographs from Barber's life, including her radio and television appearances, photos at the Kentucky Derby, with friends, riding horses, and photoshoots.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: The Realia series comprises miscellaneous items from Barber's life, such as her tarot deck, coffee mugs from radio shows she was on, and a family reunion t-shirt.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: The Audiovisual Materials series comprises video cassettes, audio cassettes, reels of radio and talk show appearances, music records, and a disk of radio and talk show appearances made by Barber Clark in her capacity as a psychic. Several video tapes include appearances by her on the nationally syndicated news and entertainment show, PM Magazine during the 1980's. Audio recordings include segments from the Barber Clark Show and many other appearances or interviews on other radio shows.
